Part A with again includes.

And code in C++:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\DataTypeTok{int}\NormalTok{ main}\OperatorTok{()\{\}}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

And in javascript:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\KeywordTok{const}\NormalTok{ a }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ b }\KeywordTok{=\textgreater{}} \DecValTok{42}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

And JSON:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\FunctionTok{\{}
  \DataTypeTok{"a"}\FunctionTok{:} \OtherTok{[}\DecValTok{{-}1}\OtherTok{,} \KeywordTok{null}\OtherTok{,} \KeywordTok{false}\OtherTok{,} \KeywordTok{true}\OtherTok{,} \DecValTok{42}\OtherTok{,} \StringTok{"yes"}\OtherTok{]}\FunctionTok{,}
  \DataTypeTok{"b"}\FunctionTok{:} \FunctionTok{\{}
    \DataTypeTok{"c"}\FunctionTok{:} \FunctionTok{\{}
      \DataTypeTok{"d"}\FunctionTok{:} \OtherTok{[]}
    \FunctionTok{\}}
  \FunctionTok{\}}
\FunctionTok{\}}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

And a list:

\hypertarget{a2-level-four}{%
\paragraph{A2 level four}\label{a2-level-four}}

Tables maybe:

\begin{longtable}[]{@{}lcr@{}}
\toprule()
Left & Middle & Right \\
\midrule()
\endfirsthead
\toprule()
Left & Middle & Right \\
\midrule()
\endhead
L1 & M2 & R3 \\
L4 & M5 & R6 \\
L7 & M8 & R9 \\
L10 & M11 & R12 \\
L13 & M14 & R15 \\
\bottomrule()
\rowcolor{white}
\caption{A caption for a table
\label{table:left-middle-right}}\tabularnewline
\end{longtable}

\hypertarget{asb}{%
\subsection{Asb}\label{asb}}

Funny image reference from upstream:


\begin{figure}
\centering
\includegraphics{images/blue.png}
\caption{MISSING-CAPTION-IN-MARKDOWN \label{fig:blue}}
\end{figure}

The parser survives the comment but:

\begin{quote}
the caption ``Caption for dot dot images in blue'' will get lost because
pandoc does not place the image in a figure environment
\end{quote}

End of sub part cascade.
